headline: Highly expressed gene shows dramatic host environment suppression and temperature-dependent regulation
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits consistently high expression levels (typically >95th percentile) across diverse laboratory conditions in Cryptococcus neoformans, but undergoes dramatic downregulation (10-150 fold) when exposed to host environments, particularly cerebrospinal fluid. Key expression patterns include:
  • Strong upregulation during stationary phase versus exponential growth
  • Temperature-dependent responses with variable effects at 37°C
  • Significant suppression in clinical isolates from cerebrospinal fluid
  • Enhanced expression in various transcriptional regulator mutants (nrg1Δ, ada2Δ, ccr4Δ)
The gene's high constitutive expression in laboratory conditions combined with its dramatic suppression in host environments suggests it may encode a metabolic enzyme or stress response protein that is actively repressed during pathogenesis to facilitate host adaptation.

topics.headline: Growth phase and temperature responses show stationary phase upregulation with variable temperature effects
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene consistently shows higher expression during stationary phase compared to exponential phase, with temperature effects varying by strain and experimental conditions but generally indicating stress responsiveness.

topics.headline: Host environment adaptation reveals dramatic suppression in cerebrospinal fluid versus laboratory conditions
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression is dramatically reduced (10-150 fold) when Cryptococcus neoformans grows in cerebrospinal fluid compared to laboratory media, suggesting active repression during CNS infection.

topics.headline: Transcriptional regulators control expression with multiple factors acting as repressors
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is upregulated in knockout mutants of several transcriptional regulators including nrg1, ada2, and ccr4, indicating these factors normally repress its expression under specific conditions.

topics.headline: Stress response pathways show context-dependent regulation under various cellular stresses
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene exhibits differential responses to multiple stress conditions including temperature stress, oxidative stress, and metal stress, with effects often dependent on specific regulatory pathway components.

topics.headline: Cell cycle and developmental processes show temporal expression changes during growth transitions
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression increases during cell cycle progression and shows time-dependent changes during sexual reproduction processes, suggesting roles in growth regulation and developmental transitions.
